Package Graphs

Class StreamGenerators

  • java.lang.Object
    • Graphs.StreamGenerators

  • public class StreamGenerators
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static methods for turning transitive relations into a stream of items. The relation may be traversed breadth-first or depth-first. The relation may either be a tree or a graph. The relations are specified by providing a successors mapping nodes to either streams or collections of successor nodes.

      static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> stream​(T start, int maxLevel, java.util.function.BiFunction<T,java.lang.Integer,java.util.stream.Stream<T>> function)
      This method generates for a tree with labelled edges a stream of nodes at a certain level.
      Example:
      IndividualConcept Jack: attribute friends attribute parents attribute age
      stream(Jack,[friends,parents,age], (concept,attribute to values))
      yields a stream of the ages of the parents of Jack's friends.

    • Method Detail

      • depthFirst

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> depthFirst​(T start,
                                                        boolean inclusive,
                                                        boolean isTree,
                                                        java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Object> successors)
        This method generates a stream which traverses a transitive relation depth-first.
        If the relation is not a tree then its elements are internally cached in order to avoid multiple occurrences of the same node in the stream, and to deal with cycles in the relation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the relation's elements.
        Parameters:
        start - The start object of the relation.
        inclusive - if false then the start node does not become part of the stream.
        successors - A function for mapping an element of the relation to a stream or collection of immediate successor elements.
        Returns:
        a stream that traverses all elements of the relation in depth-first way.

      • depthFirst

        public static <T extends Timestamped> java.util.stream.Stream<T> depthFirst​(T start,
                                                                            boolean inclusive,
                                                                            int timestamp,
                                                                            java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Object> successors)
        This method generates a stream which traverses a transitive relation depth-first.
        Its elements are timestamped in order to avoid multiple occurrences of the same node in the stream, and to deal with cycles in the relation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the relation's elements.
        Parameters:
        start - The start object of the relation.
        inclusive - if false then the start node does not become part of the stream.
        successors - A function for mapping an element of the relation to stream or collection of immediate successor elements.
        Returns:
        a stream that traverses all elements of the relation in depth-first way.

      • breadthFirst

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> breadthFirst​(T start,
                                                          boolean inclusive,
                                                          boolean isTree,
                                                          java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Object> successors)
        This method generates a stream which traverses a transitive relation breadth-first. The successor nodes for each node are provided by a successors, which either maps the node to a stream of nodes (isNode = true) or to a collection of nodes (isNode = false).
        If isTree == true then it is assumed that the graph is a tree, and there will be no check for duplicates.
        It isTree == false then all expanded nodes are put into a HashSet in order to avoid duplicates in the stream. This way the graph may even contain cycles.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the relation's elements.
        Parameters:
        start - The start object of the relation.
        inclusive - if false then 'start' is NOT inserted into the stream.
        isTree - if true then it is assumed that the graph is a tree, and no duplicates are inserted into the stream.
        successors - A function for mapping an element of the relation to a collection or a stream for the immediate successor elements.
        Returns:
        a stream that traverses all elements of the relation in a breadth-first way.

      • breadthFirst

        public static <T extends Timestamped> java.util.stream.Stream<T> breadthFirst​(T start,
                                                                              boolean inclusive,
                                                                              int timestamp,
                                                                              java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Object> successors)
        This method generates a stream which traverses a transitive relation breadth-first. The successor nodes for each node are provided by a successors, which either maps the node to a stream of nodes (isNode = true) or to a collection of nodes (isNode = false).
        Duplicates in the stream are avoided using a timestamp mechanism.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the relation's elements.
        Parameters:
        start - The start object of the relation.
        inclusive - if false then 'start' is NOT inserted into the stream.
        timestamp - an integer greater than the timestamps in all other items.
        successors - A function for mapping an element of the relation to a collection or a stream for the immediate successor elements.
        Returns:
        a stream that traverses all elements of the relation in a breadth-first way.

      • streamForTree

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> streamForTree​(T start,
                                                           boolean inclusive,
                                                           Strategy strategy,
                                                           java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Object> successors)
        This method generates a stream of nodes for a tree.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the item's type
        Parameters:
        start - the start node of the tree
        inclusive - if false then the start node is not included
        strategy - either BREADTH_FIRST or DEPTH_FIRST
        successors - a function for mapping a node to either a stream of nodes or a collection of nodes.
        Returns:
        a stream of nodes.

      • streamForTree

        public static <T extends Timestamped> java.util.stream.Stream<T> streamForTree​(T start,
                                                                               boolean inclusive,
                                                                               Strategy strategy,
                                                                               int timestamp,
                                                                               java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Object> successors)
        This method generates a stream of nodes for a tree.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the item's type
        Parameters:
        start - the start node of the tree
        inclusive - if false then the start node is not included
        strategy - either BREADTH_FIRST or DEPTH_FIRST
        timestamp - an integer greater than the timestamps in all the nodes.
        successors - a function for mapping a node to either a stream of nodes or a collection of nodes.
        Returns:
        a stream of nodes.

      • streamForGraph

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> streamForGraph​(T start,
                                                            boolean inclusive,
                                                            Strategy strategy,
                                                            java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Object> successors)
        This method generates a stream of nodes for a graph. Duplicates are avoided in the stream by storing all already delivered items in a set, and ignoring the items in this set.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the item's type
        Parameters:
        start - the start node of the graph
        inclusive - if false then the start node is not included
        strategy - either BREADTH_FIRST or DEPTH_FIRST
        successors - a function for mapping a node to either a stream of nodes or a collection of nodes.
        Returns:
        a stream of nodes.

      • streamForGraph

        public static <T extends Timestamped> java.util.stream.Stream<T> streamForGraph​(T start,
                                                                                boolean inclusive,
                                                                                Strategy strategy,
                                                                                int timestamp,
                                                                                java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Object> successors)
        This method generates a stream of nodes for a graph. Duplicates are avoided in the stream using timestamps
        Type Parameters:
        T - the item's type
        Parameters:
        start - the start node of the tree
        inclusive - if false then the start node is not included
        strategy - either BREADTH_FIRST or DEPTH_FIRST
        timestamp - an integer greater than the timestamps of all nodes in the tree.
        successors - a function for mapping a node to either a stream of nodes or a collection of nodes.
        Returns:
        a stream of nodes.

      • stream

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> stream​(T start,
                                                    int maxLevel,
                                                    java.util.function.BiFunction<T,java.lang.Integer,java.util.stream.Stream<T>> function)
        This method generates for a tree with labelled edges a stream of nodes at a certain level.
        Example:
        IndividualConcept Jack: attribute friends attribute parents attribute age
        stream(Jack,[friends,parents,age], (concept,attribute to values))
        yields a stream of the ages of the parents of Jack's friends.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the node type
        Parameters:
        start - the start node
        maxLevel - the list of edge labels
        function - a successors (node,label to Stream of successor nodes)
        Returns:
        a stream of the nodes accessible via the edge labels
